title: Channel 4's Dispatches investigating Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Prince Andrew’s controversial friendship with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein is being investigated in tonight’s special episode of Dispatches.

The documentary series will look into the powerful pair’s 12 year friendship, looking into how often they met up and how close they were before Prince Andrew, Duke Of York, distanced himself from the mogul following the allegations against him.

Titled The Prince and The Paedophile, the episode will also dive into allegations made against the Prince, all of which he has strongly denied.

Talking to close relations and pals of Andrew, the show aims to lift the lid on the pair before Epstein was arrested, and ultimately died by hanging, in prison in August this year.

Lady Victoria Hervey claims that Epstein considered the Prince a ‘trophy’ for his status in the interviews, and they bonded after Andrew’s divorce from Sarah Ferguson, Duchess of York, in 1996.

She told the cameras: ‘Jeffrey collected people. He was almost addicted to collecting important people.’

‘He liked to impress people. So, the British Royal Family, can you imagine?,’ she added. ‘This was his biggest kind of trophy.’

Prince Andrew and Epstein’s controversial friendship will be put under the spotlight (Picture: AP/Rex)

Mike Firsten, a former police detective sergeant in Florida who investigated Epstein, also claims that Epstein had 13 phone numbers to contact Andrew.

It also uncovers claims by Virginia Roberts-Giuffre who in court documents accused Andrew of having sex with her as part of an orgy with Epstein and nine other women.

She alleges that she was trafficked by Epstein to have sex with his powerful friends, including Prince Andrew, three times.

More: Prince Andrew Duke of York When did Princess Eugenie get married and when is Princess Beatrice getting married? Sarah Ferguson breaks silence on Prince Andrew's ties to Jeffrey Epstein Virginia Roberts says she ‘had sex’ with Prince Andrew in a loo when she was 17

All the allegations against the Duke were struck from the court record in 2015 after being described as ‘immaterial and impertinent’ by a judge.

These are claims that Prince Andrew has also adamantly denied.

Dispatches: The Prince & the Paedophile airs tonight at 10pm on Channel 4.
